boat.name: Ayesha
boat.full_description: Sold 2007  Full Blue Book history. Extensively restored in 1999 and put back to gaff rig. Sailed to the Mediterranean and raced in the Classics racing circuit (2000) She has raced successfully under her present ownership winning the inaugural Pin Mill classics regatta in 2006. Pictured in Classic Boat 221 November 2006 page 27. A unique performance boat, and probably the most exciting gaffer to sail on the East Coast, if not the UK.  Instruments: Tackticks wind/speed/echosounder/nmea link (2007) Furuno Radar Icom vhf SSB radio Garmin 276 plotter Steering compass 2 battery system Masthead tricolour and anchor (2007) Fridge with independent solar panel and battery.  Cabin: 4 oil lamps 3 electric lamps 2 single berths 1 double berth 2 burner cooker and grill Folding table.  CQR and Fisherman anchors with chain and cable. Manual anchor winch (2006) Manual bilge pump Bronze deck winches. Automatic electric bilge pump All running rigging replaced 2006 Standing rigging new 2000 completely reviewed 2007.  Sails: Jib topsail 2006 Main, jib, staysail, topsail 2001 Reacher 2003
boat.short_description: Dicovered in a rundown state in Kent, requiring a complete refit at which point she was returned to her original gaff rig. Relaunched in 2000 she raced the Prada series in the Med in 2001 all credit to her builders she is fast, strong and sound.
